title: Steve-O ready for 30-Day jail sentence after anti-SeaWorld stunt
text:
1 of 2 | License Photo HOLLYWOOD, Oct. 8 (UPI) -- Stunt performer Steve-O has been sentenced to 30 days in LA County Jail stemming from his anti-Seaworld stunt back in August.
The Jackass star, formally identified as Stephen Glover, took to Instagram Wednesday to share his upbeat attitude regarding the sentence and how it can bring further attention to his cause.
"Considering I've become a clean and sober, dog-rescuing vegan, I must say I'm ready to go to jail- - not just because it will bring so much attention to the plight of orcas in captivity, but because it's nice to let people know I haven't lost my edge, Steve-O wrote. "What can I say, I'm a jackass."
The photo showed a comic of Steve-O and an orca in jail having a cell-to-cell conversation.
"My whole crane-climbing, fireworks debacle really turned out to be pretty meaningful in the end, too. I mean, if your goal is to make a statement about captivity, you may as well get yourself locked up!," he continued.
I just got sentenced to 30 days in LA County jail, and this is what I have to say about it: "Considering I've become a clean and sober, dog-rescuing vegan, I must say I'm ready to go to jail-- not just because it will bring so much attention to the plight of orcas in captivity, but because it's nice to let people know I haven't lost my edge. What can I say, I'm a jackass. My whole crane-climbing, fireworks debacle really turned out to be pretty meaningful in the end, too. I mean, if your goal is to make a statement about captivity, you may as well get yourself locked up! To help give back to the City of Los Angeles, I launched a campaign today to raise money for at-risk, inner city youth, by raffling off chances to win an all-expenses-paid trip to be my red carpet, VIP guest at the taping of my Showtime comedy special next month, which is called "Steve-O: Guilty As Charged". There is a link to a new crazy stunt video I just made to let people enter to win in my bio. Los Angeles, I love you, thank you for everything!" -Steve-O (cartoon by @mikehillier_design)
A photo posted by Steve-O (@officiallysteveo) on Oct 7, 2015 at 10:13am PDT
Steve-O's protest involved the comedian scaling a sky-high crane while shooting fireworks and hanging an inflatable whale with anti-Seaworld message. Steve-O documented the climb on social media before climbing down at the request of police. He was later charged with five misdemeanors including creating a false emergency,trespassing, possessing and using fireworks without permit and conspiracy to commit a crime.
The 41-year-old also announced that next month he will begin taping a Showtime comedy special entitled, Steve-O: Guilty As Charged .
